ygData.subject: Re: Link errrors with demo.cpp

It looks like you need to add the cantera libraries to the linker 
input.  =
I just started looking at Cantera 1.7 with SUNDIALS and the 
VC7 demo solut=
ion links against the following libraries:
oneD.lib zeroD.lib transport.lib=
 cantera.lib 

NVEC_SER.lib CVODES.lib SUNDIALS_SHARED.lib 
tpx.lib ctmath.=
lib ctlapack.lib ctblas.lib ctcxx.lib ctf2c.lib


--- In cantera@yahoogroup=
s.com, "shyam_umcp" <shyam_umcp@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>   I am trying to =
compile and build a basic demo program (demo.cpp)
> using visual studio.net=
 (2003) and cantera 1.5.5. I am having 
linking
> errors and these are the =
messages thrown by vc++:
> 
> LINK : error LNK2020: unresolved token (0A000=
074) 
Cantera.ChemEquil.__dtor
> LINK : error LNK2020: unresolved token (0A=
000080)
> Cantera.Constituents.__dtor
> LINK : error LNK2020: unresolved to=
ken (0A000082)
> Cantera.ReactionStoichMgr.__dtor
> LINK : error LNK2020: u=
nresolved token (0A000090) 
Cantera.State.__dtor
> LINK : error LNK2020: un=
resolved token (0A000094)
> ?__factory@FalloffFactory@Cantera@@0PAV12@A
> L=
INK : error LNK2020: unresolved token (0A000098) 
ct.ctvector_int.__dtor
> =
LINK : error LNK2020: unresolved token (0A00009B) 
ct.ctvector_fp.__dtor
> =
LINK : fatal error LNK1120: 7 unresolved externals
> 
>  I would be really =
glad if someone could help me out. I have done 
all
> the following steps:
=
> 1.changed options to multithread dll.
> 2.added include libraries in proj=
ect settings.
> 3.added lib folder from cantera in the additional link libr=
ary 
folder.
> 4.added msvcp71.dll, msvcr71.dll and clib.dll to the 
window=
s/system 
> folder.
> 5.included all header files in my code(cantera,equili=
brium,gri30.h 
etc..)
> 
> Are there any more things i need to do or is the=
re any mistake in 
what
> i have done so far?
>
